column1: EVTDESC185;The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Temperance League has been increasingly active in one of our states this year

column3: pushing for greater support for their campaign.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC186;The libertine culture in $COUNTRY$ has drawn criticism
column2: with news of a scandal that reaches to the very heights of government. Several ministers are accused of unsavory dealings
column3: and there are calls in $CAPITAL$ for the government to support religious groups in their calls for moderation and temperance.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC2020_NEW;Romance is in the air in one of our provinces
column2: where a marriage between one of the province's immigrant sons
column3: and a young local girl
column4: is being celebrated by friends and family. Some decry the development as the end of $COUNTRY_ADJ$ civilization
column5: but the young couple sure do look happy. Immigration is changing $COUNTRY$ in ways both big and small.;Il flotte un parfum de romantisme en $PROVINCENAME$ où
column6: amis et familles célèbrent le mariage d'un fils d'immigrant avec une jeune fille du coin. Certains dénoncent ce mariage comme la fin de la civilisation $COUNTRY_ADJ$
column7: mais le jeune couple semble aux anges. L'immigration modifie indéniablement le visage de $PROVINCENAME$.;In $PROVINCENAME$ liegt Romantik in der Luft: Freunde und Familie feiern die Hochzeit zwischen einem Einwanderersohn und einem jungen lokalen Mädchen. Manche verunglimpfen diese Entwicklung als das Ende der $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Zivilisation
column8: aber das junge Paar sind auf jeden Fall sehr glücklich aus. Die Immigration verändert $PROVINCENAME$ im Großen wie im Kleinen.;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC2040_NEW;The many immigrants who have arrived in the country have created a demand for housing. The construction of new homes must be speeded up when reports show that many immigrants share housing with up to ten or twenty people. This is a minor disaster as this could create epidemics
column2: revolts and other disturbances.;Le nombre d'immigrants qui sont arrivés dans le pays a créé une forte demande pour le logement. La construction de nouveaux logements doit être accélérée car les rapports montrent que de nombreux immigrants partagent un logement avec un maximum de dix ou vingt personnes. Il s'agit d'un désastre mineur
column3: car cela pourrait créer des épidémies
column4: des révoltes et d'autres perturbations.;Die vielen ins Land strömenden Einwanderer haben einen Bauboom ausgelöst. Der Bau neuer Häuser muss beschleunigt werden
column5: da Berichten zufolge viele Einwanderer sich zu zehnt oder zwanzigst ein Haus teilen. Dies ist eine kleine Katastrophe
column6: da diese Umstände zu Epidemien
column7: Revolten und anderen Unannehmlichkeiten führen könnten.;;Los muchos inmigrantes que han llegado al país han generado una demanda de alojamiento. La construcción de nuevas casas tiene que acelerarse. Los informes muestran que muchos inmigrantes comparten casa con grupos de entre diez y veinte personas. Se trata de un pequeño desastre que puede generar epidemias
column8: revueltas y otras molestias.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC2050_NEW;Immigrants in one of our provinces have gone out in a demonstration
column2: protesting the lack of equal citizenship
column3: and demanding equal recognition under the law for all $COUNTRY_ADJ$ citizens.;Les immigrants de $PROVINCENAME$ ont manifesté pour protester contre un traitement qu'ils jugent inégal et exiger la reconnaissance légale de tous les citoyens $COUNTRY_ADJ$.;Die Immigranten in $PROVINCENAME$ haben sich zu einer Demonstration zusammengefunden und protestieren gegen ihre eingeschränkten Bürgerrechte. Sie fordern die rechtliche Gleichberechtigung aller $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Bürger.;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC2060_NEW;Riots have broken out in one of our province's immigrant communities. While formally citizens
column2: many immigrants feel that the state does not accord them proper recognition
column3: and that they do not have the same opportunities as proper nationals.;Des émeutes ont éclaté dans les communautés d'immigrants en $PROVINCENAME$. Officiellement naturalisés
column4: bon nombre d'immigrants estiment que l'État ne leur accorde pas suffisamment de reconnaissance et qu'ils ne bénéficient pas des mêmes faveurs que les nationaux.;In den Einwanderergemeinden von $PROVINCENAME$ sind Aufstände ausgebrochen. Obwohl sie formell Bürger sind
column5: haben viele Einwanderer das Gefühl
column6: dass der Staat ihnen die volle Anerkennung verweigert
column7: und dass sie nicht dieselben Möglichkeiten wie vollwertige Bürger haben.;;;;;;;;;;;x

column3: and to the government for which it stands'\n\nNot one eye dry in the audience today
column4: as some of our immigrants today took the pledge of allegiance

column1: EVTDESC2080_NEW;Immigrants arriving in $COUNTRY$ often have small means both in terms of money and in terms of opportunity. Many of them have wound up in poor quarters
column2: and those quarters are increasingly taking on the characteristics of a ghetto. It could be a good idea to do something about these squalid living conditions
column3: lest they worsen.;Les immigrants qui arrivent en $COUNTRY$ sont souvent démunis. Bon nombre d'entre eux se sont installés dans les quartiers pauvres de $PROVINCENAME$ et ceux-ci ressemblent de plus en plus à des ghettos. Il serait bon d'agir pour améliorer ces conditions de vie déplorable avant que la situation ne s'aggrave.;Neuankömmlingen in $COUNTRY$ fehlt es oft an Geld und Gelegenheiten. Viele von ihnen sind in den Armenvierteln von $PROVINCENAME$ gelandet
column4: die zunehmend die Eigenschaften von Ghettos annehmen. Es wäre vielleicht eine gute Idee
column5: etwas gegen diese verwahrlosten Lebensbedingungen zu unternehmen
column6: sonst könnten sie schlechter werden.;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC2090_NEW;Newly arrived immigrants in of our provinces are finding it hard to assimilate into the broader $COUNTRY_ADJ$ populace
column2: and many among the local population have come to view them as an alien presence. Immigrants live in separate areas of the city
column3: go to separate schools and shops
column4: and generally have very little contact with the extended community.;Les immigrants nouvellement arrivés en $PROVINCENAME$ ont bien du mal à s'intégrer à la population $COUNTRY_ADJ$
column5: au sein de laquelle nombreux sont ceux à les considérer comme des étrangers. Les immigrants vivent dans les quartiers bien distincts de la ville
column6: fréquentent des écoles et des magasins différents et ont
column7: de manière générale
column8: que très peu de contact avec la communauté au sens large.;Kürzlich eingetroffene Immigranten in $PROVINCENAME$ finden es schwierig
column9: sich der breiteren $COUNTRY_ADJ$ Bevölkerung anzupassen
column10: und viele Mitglieder der lokalen Bevölkerung nehmen sie mittlerweile aus ausländische Präsenz wahr. Einwanderer leben in gesonderten Stadtteilen
column11: gehen auf andere Schulen und kaufen in anderen Geschäften ein. Generell haben sie kaum Kontakt zur allgemeinen Bevölkerung.;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC2100_NEW;Following an extended period of civil unrest in one of our provinces
column2: local anti-immigrant sentiments have exploded into a full scale riot. Shop windows have been smashed
column3: and several of the recently arrived have been murdered
column4: as immigrants are blamed for all manner of social ills
column5: real or perceived;Suite à l'agitation civile dont a été victime $PROVINCENAME$
column6: des sentiments xénophobes se sont manifestés au cours d'une manifestation d'envergure. Des portes de magasins ont été défoncées et plusieurs immigrants ont été assassinés
column7: ceux-ci étant jugés comme responsables de tous les maux sociaux
column8: réels ou non.;Nach längeren zivilen Unruhen in $PROVINCENAME$ ist die lokale Stimmung gegen Einwanderer nun in einem heftigen Aufstand explodiert. Da man die Immigranten für alle tatsächlichen und vermeintlichen sozialen Missstände verantwortlich macht
column9: wurden mehrere der Neuankömmlinge ermordet. Außerdem wurden Schaufenster eingeworfen.;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC2110_NEW;Newly-arrived immigrants have brought with them the collected experiences of their home country
column2: and their songs now blend with ours in the ever-changing symphony that is $COUNTRY$. Their customs have enriched our own
column3: and created interesting new blends of cultural expression in the fields of art
column4: science and architecture.;Les immigrés qui viennent de s'installer en $PROVINCENAME$ sont imprégnés de la culture de leur pays natal. Leurs chants se mêlent désormais aux nôtres pour former une symphonie en constante évolution
column5: la symphonie de $COUNTRY$. Leurs coutumes ont enrichi les nôtres et ce mélange culturel a engendré de nouvelles formes d'expression dans les domaines des arts
column6: des sciences et de l'architecture.;Die neu in $PROVINCENAME$ eingetroffenen Immigranten haben die kollektiven Erfahrungen ihres Heimatlandes mitgebracht. Ihre Lieder fließen nun in die in stetem Wandel befindliche Symphonie ein
column7: die $COUNTRY$ darstellt. Ihre Gebräuche haben unsere eigenen bereichert und in den Bereichen Kunst
column8: Wissenschaft und Architektur zu interessanten neuen kulturellen Ausdrucksformen geführt.;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC2120_NEW;A recent immigrant was put on the returning ship back home again
column2: when local police caught him stealing from a local street vendor. The case has caused much alarm among the immigrant community
column3: many of whom are unfamiliar with our justice system
column4: who now fear that more deportations will follow.;Un immigré récemment installé en $PROVINCENAME$ a été expulsé vers son pays d'origine après avoir été arrêté pour vol à la tire. L'affaire a fait grand bruit dans la communauté immigrée locale
column5: beaucoup redoutant de nouvelles expulsions par méconnaissance de notre système judiciaire.;Ein kürzlich in $PROVINCENAME$ eingetroffener Immigrant wurde mit einem Schiff zurück in seine Heimat geschickt
column6: nachdem ihn die Polizei beim Bestehlen eines lokalen Straßenverkäufers ertappt hat. Dieser Fall hat die lokale Immigrantengemeinde
column7: deren Angehörige sich meist mit unserem Rechtssystem nicht auskennen
column8: stark alarmiert. Sie fürchten nun
column9: weitere Deportationen könnten folgen.;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC2600;$COUNTRY$ has maintained control over $STATENAME$ for us to consider the possibility of integrating it into $COUNTRY$ as a whole. There are $COUNTRY_ADJ$ flags waving in $PROVINCENAME$
column2: flown by $COUNTRY_ADJ$ citizens
column3: so it does not seem so far-fetched an idea that $STATENAME$ be eventually considered $COUNTRY_ADJ$ territory by the world at large.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC2605;$COUNTRY$ has controlled $PROVINCENAME$ for a long time-- long enough for those within $PROVINCENAME$ to truly consider themselves $COUNTRY_ADJ$ citizens
column2: and for the rest of the world to consider the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ claim to the province to be legitimate as well. Though there are still some unhappy with the development
column3: $PROVINCENAME$ is now considered an integral part of $COUNTRY$.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC2610;$STATENAME$ is considered $COUNTRY_ADJ$ territory-- that is only in dispute by those neighbours who still have recognized claims on the area
column2: and who maintain that many within $STATENAME$ consider themselves citizens of their country and not ours. The first step in rendering their claim invalid would be to enact a policy that encourages the assimilation of all people within $STATENAME$... they should be $COUNTRY_ADJ$ citizens
column3: and hold no other nationality above ours.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC2611;With the new government in power and its more liberal views on minorities within $COUNTRY$
column2: the policies of assimilation that attempted to stamp out minorities of other nationalities have all been rescinded. There are those within the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ military who warn that this is a dangerous idea
column3: and that allowing these foreign identities to perpetuate will only lead to further conflict with our neighbours-- but
column4: for now
column5: their voices have been ignored.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC2615;A demonstration in $PROVINCENAME$ turned violent as minorities held up $COUNTRY_ADJ$ flags and burned them-- a demonstration of their rejection of our attempts to assimilate them into $COUNTRY$. Authorities broke up the demonstration
column2: but there continues to be a growing discontent in the area. The turmoil has even spread to other citizens
column3: who have begun calling on the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government to end its assimilation policies and let the minority groups be.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC2616;The recent arrest of a foreign national in $PROVINCENAME$ has led to a diplomatic incident. Many of the minorities within $PROVINCENAME$ claim that the man was arrested solely because he opposed the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ assimilation policies
column2: and was trying to spread word of a peaceful resistance. The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ authorities say the man's interest was not peaceful in the least
column3: and they suspect he in fact works for one of our neighbours with a claim on $PROVINCENAME$. Whatever the truth
column4: the reaction has not been peaceful in the least-- riots are expected
column5: and authorities say to be wary of rebellion in the area.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC2620;A parade has recently taken place in $PROVINCENAME$
column2: with the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ flag flying high-- and being held by people who
column3: until very recently
column4: likely wouldn't have considered themselves $COUNTRY_ADJ$ citizens at all. $PROVINCENAME$ is still claimed by another country
column5: but the acceptance of $PROVINCENAME$'s people is going a long way towards making elimination of that an inevitable fact.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC2625;The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ flag is the only one that can now be found flying in the streets of $PROVINCENAME$. At long last
column2: it can be considered $COUNTRY_ADJ$ and only $COUNTRY_ADJ$ territory. Even those who are members of other cultures no longer consider themselves truly part of our neighbours-- much as those neighbours might be unhappy with the situation.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC2626;$FROMCOUNTRY$ continues to hold some of our lands
column2: lands which until today have always been considered part of $COUNTRY_ADJ$ national territory. A $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ program of assimilation has succeeded
column3: however
column4: in weaning our own people away from any feeling as if this true. They no longer consider themselves $COUNTRY_ADJ$
column5: and indeed the international community appears to agree with them.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC2650;According to our peace treaty with $FROMCOUNTRY$
column2: we must give up lands that rightfully belong to them-- and only the ones that belong to them.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC2651;According to our peace treaty with $FROMCOUNTRY$
column2: we must give up lands that rightfully belong to another nation-- but only those lands.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC2660;As a result of the treaty with $FROMCOUNTRY$
column2: some of $COUNTRY$'s lands are to be returned. We are
column3: however
column4: only entitled to those lands over which we have a claim. Any others should
column5: by all rights
column6: be returned to $FROMCOUNTRY$.\n\n§RNOTE: If you took $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ core provinces which are not also your own core provinces in this war
column7: enacting the 'return' option will give those lands back. Be careful!§W;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC10229;With the people seemingly ready to break down our doors
column2: demanding constitutional reform
column3: perhaps we should consider giving it to them? Some moderate reforms
column4: allowing the masses their vote but retaining ultimate power for the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ aristocracy and the Kaiser
column5: should please them enough to dispel this rabble... for now.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC10400;The unrest in France hit its height recently
column2: with crowds streaming through the streets of Paris and erecting barricades. In what was widely regarded as an accident
column3: a French guardsmen fired his musket on the citizens and set off a massacre. The resulting conflagaration has swept the city
column4: with crowds chanting 'Long live the Reform!' and 'Down with the King!'. Despite assurances that everything is under control
column5: the king has abdicated and fled the country… leaving a provisional government to step in and declare the Second Republic.\n\nNow we have the task of building this new government
column6: starting with a presidential election to determine its new Head of State. Considering the popularity of Louis-Napoléon Bonaparte among the masses
column7: and the granting of universal voting rights
column8: some are concerned that he may in fact take the leadership. If he does
column9: who knows what this may mean for France?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC10401;While it was expected that Louis-Napoléon Bonaparte would do well in the French presidential election
column2: no one could have counted on the fact that he has done as well as this. Despite his autocratic leanings and lack of allies in Paris
column3: he has managed to be something to everyone… even gaining the sponsorship of the Orleanists. The provisional government's candidate
column4: Louis-Eugène Cavaignac
column5: led the effort to quell an uprising in the city-- leading to resentment among the masses which has translated into Napoleon's landslide. Many fear the man takes too much after his infamous uncle
column6: and thus the idea has arisen of fixing the elections to ensure Cavaignac's victory. This would require us to restrict universal sufferage
column7: as well as muffle the newspapers and political opponents. Either way
column8: the ideals of the Second Republic seem at risk of compromise.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC10402;Louis-Napoléon Bonaparte has swept into power as France's new Head of State. The man carries with him the legacy of his infamous uncle
column2: and with it the support of the masses. He has no friends in Paris
column3: however
column4: almost all of whom are nervous of the possibility that he might decide to follow in his uncle's footsteps.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC10405;Unable to force the Upper House to repeal its prohibition against presidential re-election and facing removal from power
column2: the popular Louis-Napoleon has launched a coup d'etat and overthrown the French government. Loyal members of the army have locked down strategic locations in Paris
column3: and the Assemblée Nationale has been dissolved
column4: leaving Louis-Napoleon as the undisputed ruler of the country. He has been christened Napoléon III
column5: regaining his uncle's throne as the Emperor of France.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC10410;The popularity of Louis-Napoleon has waned. Where once it was expected that his ascension would return France to the greatness it experienced during the reign of his uncle
column2: instead France sees itself being eclipsed by its neighbours. The Emperor has cultivated many enemies among the liberals in Paris
column3: and now they have chosen their moment to strike. Napoleon has been deposed
column4: and the only question remains as to what form France shall now take. Shall we restore the Bourbon dynasty under the Count of Chambord
column5: elect for a Bourbon constitutional monarchy under the Comte de Paris
column6: or instead opt to create the Third Republic?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC10411;Louis-Napoleon has grown ill in recent months
column2: slowly surrendering more and more ground to the Upper House. Thus his death comes with no surprise to many. Mourned by the entire nation
column3: and by his beloved Empress Eugénie
column4: the question now turns to who will follow him. His son and heir would be Napoleon IV… but he is still a young man
column5: eager to live up to the legacy left him. Others favor the popular Bourbon Count of Paris. Still more
column6: however
column7: claim this is the perfect moment to restore the republic and end the monarchy once and for all.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC11115;Many within the $COUNTRY$ have always considered it a dream to form a greater union of the Slavic peoples
column2: one spanning all of the Balkans and uniting them under a common flag. Such a nation would be far better suited at resisting the encroachment of foreign powers into the region. Now seems like the perfect opportunity for $COUNTRY$ to form such a union. Do we proceed with the creation of Yugoslavia
column3: or let the dream die here?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC11120;The call has come to $COUNTRY$ to unite with Yugoslavia
column2: a union of Slavic countries interested in protecting the Balkans from the encroachment of other European powers. Whether a union of cultures which have before now often been at war
column3: and indeed still have considerable enmity for each other
column4: will be difficult to say.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTNAME12020;Tragedy at the Coal Mine;La fille de $PROVINCENAME$;Das Mädchen aus $PROVINCENAME$;;La niña de $PROVINCENAME$;;;;;;;;;x
EVTDESC12020;The coal laden tub must have weighed heavily on her body
column2: fragile and worn from many years of ardous labour in the coal pits
column3: for her feet could no longer carry her. There

column7: and the particular tragedy of the case has recieved national attention.;La benne en pleine charge de charbon doit avoir pesé lourdement sur son corps

column10: dans l'obscurité profonde
column11: elle glissa et tomba. \n\nUne autre jeune fille a perdu sa vie dans un accident de mines de charbon dans une de nos provinces
column12: et la tragédie particulière de ce cas a retenu l'attention nationale. ;Die kohlebeladene Wanne muss schwer auf ihrem Körper gelastet haben

column22: resbaló y cayó.\n\nOtra joven niña ha perdido la vida en un accidente en una mina de carbón de una de nuestras provincias. Lo particularmente trágico del caso ha llamado la atención de toda la nación.;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC12040;Locals in one of our provinces are complaining about certain emissions coming from the local fertilizer factory. While the place might smell like roses to the provincial budget
column2: the balance certainly hasn't been adding up for local noses lately. We could support an ordinance to modifiy the work process
column3: but doing so might anger local captains of industry.;Les sections locales de $PROVINCENAME$ se plaignent de certaines émissions provenant de l'usine d'engrais proche. Bien que l'endroit doit sentir la rose pour le budget provincial

column1: EVTDESC85020;With increasing frustration against government corruption and foreign influence in $COUNTRY$
column2: a rebel movement has appeared among followers of the Tonghak or 'Eastern Learning' ideology. They have been stirring up the peasant classes
column3: forming poorly-armed if numerous armies to purge the capital and rid the country of Japanese and other foreign presence. We will need to move quickly if we wish to prevent them from overthrowing the government or causing an incident with neighbouring powers.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC85021;The unrest caused by the Tonghak movement appears to be coming to an end. The militant leaders have vanished into the countryside
column2: and their followers have dispersed. Order is restored-- for now.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC85025;The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government has received reports of a massive rebellion forming in Korea
column2: serious enough that several members of the Korean government have sent an urgent call to $COUNTRY$ to intervene. Any forces we dispatch will likely provoke a response from Japan
column3: who will fear that we are attempting to uproot their influence. This may
column4: however
column5: be an opportunity for $COUNTRY$ to solidify our own influence in Korea-- many advisors are saying that we cannot allow the potential response from Japan stop us from acting.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC85026;We have received reports that the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government has moved to intervene in the Tonghak Rebellion currently underway in Korea. It seems likely that
column2: should $FROMCOUNTRY$ succeed in quelling the rebellion

The only sensible move is to send in forces to overthrow the Korean government and replace it with one that is more firmly pro-Japanese-- despite the conflict this will all but certainly spark with $FROMCOUNTRY$.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC85027;Reacting to reports that the Chinese are planning to intervene in the Tonghak Rebellion

column3: effectively rendering us a $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ vassal. Both rebels and loyalist forces throughout the country have reacted in rage.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC85028;Responding to news of our intended intervention

column3: effectively rendering Korea a $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ vassal
column4: with orders to end any agreements and alliances with $COUNTRY$ and ban our forces from entering their nation. This is
column5: of course
column6: an insult of the highest magnitude.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: the Chinese have moved forces into Korea-- entering $CAPITAL$ and effectively setting up a government under their complete control in a swift coup. That there has been no reaction from the Japanese government is surprising
column3: just as it is frustrating that our embattled armies have had no chance to agree to this so-called 'help' from the Chinese. Either way
column4: rebels and loyalists alike are enraged at this foreign intrusion.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC85030;The rebellion in Korea has grown worse
column2: and already we have reports of the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ consulate under assault by rebel forces. It seems the Korean government is helpless. Considering that the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ stands by doing nothing

column4: it seems we are in a position to act-- some are suggesting that we engineer a pro-Japanese coup in Seoul to install a government more firmly in our control
column5: and prevent any possibility of an overthrow eliminating our influence.;;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC90023;The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government has finally given in to $COUNTRY_ADJ$ demands for local self-government. Today marks a historic occasion as the new national flag is raised in $CAPITAL$

column1: EVTDESC95267;'Whereas once the dream of our rightful independence was crushed
column2: we stand here in the city of Richmond to declare that it has been reborn. No longer can the South remain under the heel of the North and call it freedom-- the Confederacy must rise again!'/n/nWith those words
column3: a large group of delegates gathered in Richmond have declared the Confederate States of America reborn. At least one state has agreed to secede
column4: and its possible that others will join them… now or very soon. If we are to stop this new rebellion
column5: we will need to act quickly.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95268;A group of politicians has gathered in $PROVINCENAME$
column2: issuing a declaration that the state of $STATENAME$ would hereby secede from the Union and join with the Confederate States of America.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95269;'Whereas once our land was the frontier of America
column2: now it is the frontier of freedom. The Oregon Country is a land where men achieve their destiny through honest toil and while believing in the equality of men. Since the Union no longer believes in the same
column3: we hereby declare it dead.'/n/nWith these words
column4: a group of delegates gathering in the city of Portland have declared the secession of Oregon from the Union. While other parts of the region may join them
column5: it's unknown whether everyone there feels the same. Clearly this rebellion must be stopped before it gains further traction.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95270;A group of politicians has gathered in $PROVINCENAME$
column2: issuing a declaration that the state of $STATENAME$ would hereby secede from the Union and join with the Oregon Country.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95271;'We are the true heartland of America. We know things that Washington has forgotten: the value of honesty
column2: the need for virtue
column3: and the true meaning of freedom. What they have put aside
column4: we shall pick up and keep close to our hearts-- for now
column5: a new nation is born. A republic that will stand the test of time as the nation we step away from has not.'/n/nWith these words
column6: a group of delegates gathered in the city of Denver has declared the creation of the Colorado Republic. Whether more states will join their rebellion still remains to be seen.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95272;A group of politicians has gathered in $PROVINCENAME$
column2: issuing a declaration that the state of $STATENAME$ would hereby secede from the Union and join with the Colorado Republic.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95273;'What the fools in Washington have forgotten is that we are not their subjects. We are their allies. If they abuse us
column2: we do not lie back and ask for forgiveness. We leave. That is what we do here today: we are forging a new alliance of equals
column3: brothers with a common heritage who will never forget the evils that lie in tyranny and corruption.'/n/nWith these words
column4: a group of delegates gathering in the city of Chicago have declared the formation of a 'New American Alliance'. The state of Illinois has seceded from the Union to create it
column5: and it's entirely possible that others will join them if we do not act quickly.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95274;A group of politicians has gathered in $PROVINCENAME$
column2: issuing a declaration that the state of $STATENAME$ would hereby secede from the Union and join with the New American Alliance.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95275;'Ours is a nation born of resolution. The Washington government thought it could stretch its hand across the breadth of North America

column5: and it's possible that others may soon join them. Do they not realize how short-lived their rebellion will surely be?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95276;A group of politicians has gathered in $PROVINCENAME$
column2: issuing a declaration that the state of $STATENAME$ would hereby secede from the Union and join with the Dakota Republic.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95277;'We have been the subjects of despots in Mexico as well as cruel tyrants in Washington
column2: and we stand here before you today to declare that we will stand for neither. Ours is a unique heritage
column3: and we will move forward with the intention of celebrating it in the spirit of freedom and goodwill for all mankind.'/n/nWith these words
column4: a group of delegates gathered in Phoenix have declared the formation of a 'Pueblo Republic'. Arizona and New Mexico have both seceded from the union to form it
column5: daring us to stop their rebellion-- if we can.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95278;'Our path lies in a different direction-- with our hearts
column2: our faith
column3: and our integrity. May God watch over us and keep us safe in this perilous world.'/n/nWith these words

column5: encompassing both Utah and Nevada. They stand ready to resist any attempt by us to retake them through force.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95279;'Our joining of the Union was with the understanding that it meant something-- we were joining a cause for true freedom in a world full of totalitarianism
column2: a cause far greater than any we could hope to achieve on our own. We were mistaken
column3: and now we must march forward on our own terms. May God help us all.'/n/nWith these words
column4: the governor of California met with a large number of delegates in San Francisco and declared their state seceded from the Union-- to the widespread support of many Californians.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95280;'We are the Lone Star State. We fought against the Mexicans and succeeded
column2: and now we shall fight against the Yankees if they come. Let them come. Texas bows before no-one.'/n/nWith these words
column3: the governor of Texas stood before a group of gathered delegates and declared their state seceded from the Union. Already an army of supporters is gathering in Austin
column4: ready to fight against any reprisal from Washington.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95611;Advisors to the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government are warning that the British will continue their northward expansion. If we do not press south
column2: Russia will soon have its southern borders exposed to European invasion. It does us no good to allow the British complete hegemony over Central Asia. Something must be done!;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95612;The Great Game between the British Empire and Russia has one pushing ever northward and the other pushing ever southward
column2: with $COUNTRY$ caught in-between. Recently
column3: $COUNTRY_ADJ$ soldiers got into a skirmish with one of our neighbours... and the resulting incident has brought the infernal gaze of one of these powers upon us
column4: perhaps meaning war.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95613;Thanks to the Great Game and its maneuvering
column2: tensions with $FROMCOUNTRY$ have been rising. Recently
column3: an incident occurred near their border where several $COUNTRY_ADJ$ soldiers were attacked by $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ soldiers. There were several deaths
column4: and while the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government is apologetic there are those within $COUNTRY$ who are calling for us to move in and assume control of their government.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95614;It seems that $FROMCOUNTRY$ is content to accept the incident was not our intent and turn its attentions elsewhere. For the moment

column1: EVTDESC95616;Unrest within $FROMCOUNTRY$ against $COUNTRY_ADJ$ rule has reached a boiling point
column2: and it appears the only solution is to step in and rule them directly. Should we fail to do so
column3: we may find $FROMCOUNTRY$ soon taken from our control and turned into a target for a foreign power's expansion.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95640;The Paris Foreign Missions Society has been actively spreading Catholicism in Asia for many years now
column2: but they have encountered considerable persecution at the hands of Asian authorities. In $FROMCOUNTRY$
column3: the execution of several missionaries in the Cochinchina region has prompted the society to ask the French government for diplomatic intervention. So far

column1: EVTDESC95641;First they send their 'missionaries' into our country

column3: and expect us to do nothing? $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ have seized upon this excuse to demand all of Cochinchina in recompense.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95645;We have an issue before us. The Vietnamese rule over our kingdom

column3: very soon

column1: EVTDESC95646;King Norodom of Cambodia has sent our government a request: he asks that the French intervene in his nation
column2: demanding it be released from Vietnamese control and made our protectorate. This would suit our goals in Indochina
column3: though it risks war.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95647;Cambodia has been under Vietnamese control since our war with Siam. Now it seems the Cambodia king has approached the French and asked for protection
column2: and the French have agreed to offer it. They are demanding control over Cambodia
column3: on threat of war.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC95650;Many in our government believe we should press our influence in Indochina

column1: EVTDESC95652;French diplomats have arrived in $CAPITAL$ with a set of demands: namely that we should surrender control of all eastern territories not 'rightfully ours'. This includes all land claimed by Laotian
column2: Khmer and Vietnamese minorities. It is an outrageous demand

column1: EVTDESC95655;We are in a difficult situation. $COUNTRY_ADJ$ forces cannot hold out against the French onslaught
column2: and they plague us at every opportunity. Perhaps we must face the realities of the situation

column1: EVTDESC96090;With the loss of $COUNTRY$ in the recent war

There are those in the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government who say the time has come: clearly the Indians wish us gone. Others say we must not submit to what amounts to a temporary setback. The Indians can be forced to submit
column3: if we focus our efforts on the matter.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97121;The war with $FROMCOUNTRY$ has come to an abrupt end. With most of $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ India either occupied or in disarray

column1: EVTDESC975520;With rebels rampant in the south
column2: it has become next to impossible for the government to maintain order in El Salvador. Government authorities have withdrawn as locals have overtaken the capital in San Salvador.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC975521;With rebels rampant in the south

column1: EVTDESC97566;The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government is besieged by rebels

column3: it's very likely that $FROMCOUNTRY$ would cease to be in $COUNTRY$'s sphere of influence.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97642;The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ clan has made a bold move: they have declared they intend to see the emperor restored to rule over all of Japan. We have little choice
column2: as they have forced our hand. Either we rise up against the Shogun now
column3: or the Shogun will assume we are behind the rebellion even if we are not. The time has come to fight!;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97673;$COUNTRY$ has followed a militaristic path until now
column2: determined to set ourselves against our neighbours in the interest of security-- while risking that security with dangerous wars. The new $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government has determined that this must change. We must follow a path of progress
column3: and instead devote outselves to technology and westernization if we are to remain free and whole.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97674;The $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government has followed a policy of progress and westernization until now
column2: hoping that advancing $COUNTRY$ to match the Western powers would keep us safe. We now see this is in error
column3: and that only by an aggressive expansion of our borders can we hope to maintain the security of $COUNTRY$ proper.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97675;The Chinese have fallen into warring factions
column2: all but crumbling their power and leaving us an advantage we would be fools not to exploit. The Line of Advantage policy dictates that we should strike
column3: and strike soon.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: the hated Japanese have decided to strike at us and take control of our government. They shall find us a difficult target!;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97677;Our nation's policy of the Line of Advantage dictates that we must expand our borders if we are to maintain security. Naturally
column2: our most vulnerable point lies in neighbouring Korea. They must either be brought under our direct control or made into a vassal if $COUNTRY$ is to be kept safe. Already $COUNTRY_ADJ$ generals are clamoring for war.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97678;The recent murder of Japanese sailors off the coast of Formosa has given rise to a question within the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government: should we use this excuse to step in and wrest control of the southern island? The Line of Advantage is clear
column2: dictating that the land would be invaluable to our goals. But are we willing to risk such a war?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC97679;After the recent murders of a number of $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ sailors off the coast of Formosa
column2: the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government has delivered a demand: turn over the island
column3: for the sake of their security
column4: or it shall be war between $FROMCOUNTRY$ and $COUNTRY$. We know this is just an excuse for their militarist expansion... but can we stand up against their might?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC98600;There has been an increasing desire among the people of $COUNTRY$ to gain our full independence. Crowds gathering in $CAPITAL$ have demanded an end to rule by our distant overlords
column2: and while many in the government are sympathetic with their cries there are also those who fear such a demand could lead to war. Any attempts to achieve independence should ideally take a diplomatic route first
column3: with friendly ties maintained if peaceful separation becomes a reality.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC98605;Diplomats from $FROMCOUNTRY$ arrived in $CAPITAL$ this month
column2: presenting a formal request for their full independence from $COUNTRY$. They assure us that they fully intend to maintain ties with our nation
column3: and have agreed to move forward as $COUNTRY_ADJ$ allies
column4: but that they desire their freedom even so. There are many who feel such a request is beyond the pale and must be refused out of hand. Still others say that if $FROMCOUNTRY$ is denied
column5: we could be facing a rebellion-- and is it not better than to have a friendly ally than a recalcitrant and unwilling subject?;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government has denied our request for independence. It seems our only option is rebellion-- as unrealistic as some claim that option to be.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC98607;Our diplomacy has proven successful: $COUNTRY$ has been granted full autonomy

column1: EVTDESC98620;With the Ottoman government having indicated its willingness to provide reforms
column2: an intellectual class known as the Young Ottomans has arisen-- men influenced by the ideals of the French Revolution who are advocating the assumption of secular rather than religious laws as well as the provision of rights to ethnic minorities. This
column3: they say
column4: will help stem the tide of decay in the Empire. Most recently they have suggested embracing the Empire's Bulgarian minorities
column5: maintaining that such a gesture would indicate a willingness to embrace European values. Mashriqi citizens have gotten wind of this
column6: demanding that they as Muslims should receive preferential treatment. Reactionary officials have agreed
column7: suggesting a move towards accepting the Empire's role as an Islamic power rather than away from it.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC98621;Recently the Young Ottomans have been pushing for reform in the millet system
column2: the governmental system under which the Empire's territories are allowed to govern themselves. The Young Ottomans say that the Albanians have been loyal servants to the Empire and their millets deserve equal treatment to those of the Turks. This would also indicate a willingness to embrace European ideals. Reactionaries have rejected this notion
column3: suggesting the Empire embrace the Bedouin population instead. This would indicate a commitment by the Empire towards traditional values.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC98622;The Young Ottomans have begun campaigning for equality to be granted to Bosnian citizens-- a European culture which is also Muslim
column2: and the embracing of which would further indicate an alignment towards Europe. Reactionaries have been quick to suggest that if equality is going to be granted to any distant group
column3: it should be the Maghrebi. Doing so would indicate an alignment towards reclaiming the Empire's former expanse and away from Europe and its dangerous ideas. Appeasing both groups appears to be impossible.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC98626;The current state of unrest within the Empire has reached the point where the Sultan has been advised to abrogate the Ottoman Constitution. Absolute power must be returned to the monarchy in order to stamp out the militants-- and while there are those who say that such action will only foster more unrest
column2: there are others who are all too aware that failing to do so will make the Sultan look weak. It is not beyond the realm of possibility that reactionaries might seek to restore the monarchy by force-- or
column3: even worse
column4: seek to abolish it altogether.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC98630;With the recent loss of European territories
column2: nationalists within $COUNTRY$ have been inspired to rise up. $COUNTRY_ADJ$ officials are concerned we could be seeing a string of rebellions in the years to come
column3: and already the army is scrambling to contain any efforts at rebel organization.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC98635;Spurred on by the continuing lack of reform
column2: Ottoman liberals have radicalized into the 'Young Turks'. They seek to restore the consitutional monarchy
column3: by force if need be
column4: and there are those who have advised the government that these liberals must be dealt with harshly before they grow into a real problem.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC98636;Turkish liberals have grown increasingly defiant of the Ottoman monarchy-- to the point where they suggest that the Sultan must be overthrown
column2: replaced with a modern republic. They reject the notion of Ottomanism
column3: saying it has already led to the Empire's decline
column4: and that the way to restoring the nation's glory is to put the good of the Turkish people ahead of all other concerns... including religious.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC98640;The Ottoman monarchy has been overthrown
column2: and now $COUNTRY$ stands in its place. The concept of Ottomanism
column3: an Empire formed of diverse cultures and religions
column4: has been set aside in favor of a nation built by and for the Turkish people.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC98650;The call from $FROMCOUNTRY$ has come to $COUNTRY$

column3: but many welcome the nation and rightly state that $FROMCOUNTRY$'s influence in $COUNTRY$ is already great. If we deny the union
column4: the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government may decide to enforce their claim on us whether we like it or not.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column4: though the loss to our prestige would be considerable.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC1316181;Qing officials recently boarded the Arrow
column2: a Chinese-owned ship (a lorcha) that was suspected of piracy and smuggling. Twelve Chinese crew members were arrested on suspicion of piracy by the Qing authorities. British officials have demanded the release of the sailors
column3: however
column4: claiming that because the ship had recently been British-registered
column5: it was under their protection. The Imperial court has been enraged by this claim
column6: suggesting that agreeing to British demands would give smugglers free reign throughout China.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC1316182;Qing officials recently boarded the Arrow

column4: saying that we must exert our influence over the Qing if we are to retain our position in the Far East.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC1600010;It is as we feared-- the so-called 'Heavenly Kingdom' has assumed control of lands in the south
column2: and any attempts by the local governors to resume authority have failed. It is an embarassment to the prestige of the Imperial throne that we must deign to recognize that these rebels exist and must be dealt with once and for all. Some are even beginning to question the Mandate of Heaven if such a threat is possible. If we do not act
column3: however
column4: the rebels will surely gain control over not only the south but perhaps all of China.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC160004;Though we are not yet done battling the hated Manchu

column3: and now the Manchu will need to deal with rebellions across their land as the people realize their mandate to rule no longer exists. All the world watches us.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC160008;We have overthrown the hated Manchu and taken control of all China. Now
column2: as the world watches
column3: the true test comes: transforming the nation into the true Heavenly Kingdom.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC160009;A troublemaker has arisen in the southern lands. According to reports

EVTDESC800012;We have been secretly approached by certain members within the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government
column2: suggesting that $COUNTRY_ADJ$ intervention to free them from foreign control might be in both our interests. $FROMCOUNTRY$ would be free to seek its own destiny
column3: while $COUNTRY$ would gain an ally. The catch
column4: of course
column5: is that the attempt could look like interference to the rest of the world... and earn us the enmity of $FROMCOUNTRY$'s rulers in particular. If we make the attempt
column6: we should learn of the results within the month at most.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC800013;A foreign power has meddled in the affairs of $FROMCOUNTRY$
column2: taking advantage of the unrest there to engineer a coup which has freed them from our control. Our trusted servants in that nation have been either arrested or expelled
column3: and now the world watches for our response.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC800015;The answer from $FROMCOUNTRY$ is clear: they won't intervene in our internal affairs. We are on our own.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: but the resulting orgy of violence in $CAPITAL$ has failed to drive out the influence of our overlord. Worse
column3: it has resulted in $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ influence in $COUNTRY$ being greatly damaged
column4: as many see them as instigators rather than would-be liberators.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC800017;$FROMCOUNTRY$ has supported the coud d'etat in $CAPITAL$
column2: but with the change came an orgy of violence that has seen $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ influence in $COUNTRY$ damaged along with that of our overlord. Many people in $COUNTRY$ are left with hard feelings
column3: and see $FROMCOUNTRY$ as an instigator rather than a liberator. What will come next depends entirely on whether reprisals will come our way.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC800018;$FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ intervention has succeeded in freeing our government from foreign rule. After an orgy of violence in $CAPITAL$
column2: citizens are celebrating in the streets. $COUNTRY$ has a new destiny as a truly independent nation... provided no reprisals come out way
column3: of course.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC800021;A foreign power attempted to use their influence in $FROMCOUNTRY$ to take advantage of the unrest there and free them from our control. Their efforts have come to naught
column2: and their agents have been arrested and many of the $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ malcontents exposed and imprisoned. The question remains
column3: however
column4: as to what we will do in response to this outrage.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC800022;Our attempt to interfere in $FROMCOUNTRY$'s government was thwarted. We have lost influence there
column2: and angered their overlord. This may lead to war
column3: but we will have to wait and see what develops.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC800023;Our attempt to engineer a coup in $FROMCOUNTRY$ was successful
column2: but at the cost of a great deal of our influence there. The $FROMCOUNTRY_ADJ$ government is angry
column3: and it's possible their overlords may attempt to retaliate either against them or against us. We will have to wait and see what develops of this.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC800024;Our attempt to engineer a coup in $FROMCOUNTRY$ was successful

column1: EVTDESC810057;The old $COUNTRY_ADJ$ regime leftover from our days as a colony are now over-- $COUNTRY$ is once more an African nation
column2: truly belonging to the people who have lived here since long before the Europeans arrived.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC8001160;It seems our policy of allowing the newspapers to speak as they wish is now coming to haunt us. Recently
column2: a prominent newspaper in one of our provinces has published a high-profile article criticising the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ monarchy. If we do nothing
column3: this talk will spread. Yet our only other option is to restrict the freedom of the press entirely.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column2: British committees have looked into the situation in Ireland and predicted disaster: the Irish farmers had become more and more dependent on their potato crop
column3: and if anything were to happen to that crop it would cause not only widespread chaos throughout the Irish economy but famine and worse. Their predictions have come true. A blight has been spreading
column4: leading to failure after failure of the Irish potato harvest. Proponents of laissez faire economics are adamant that the market will provide food for those affected
column5: and that the government should not interfere in private enterprise. Others claim that no expense is too high to help the Irish
column6: and that failure to act quickly will lead to starvation and resentment... but conservatives are quick to dismiss this as inflammatory nonsense.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC1010012;The blight affecting the Irish potato crop has spread to $STATENAME$. With the local harvest quickly failing
column2: the effects are already being felt-- poor Irish peasants are walking the streets of $PROVINCENAME$
column3: begging for government aid which never arrives
column4: and many are obviously considering making their way to the New World out of desperation.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column3: barely subsisting on the limited cornmeal handouts offered by the government
column4: and many are obviously considering making their way to the New World out of desperation.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC1010014;The blight affecting the Irish potato crop has spread to $STATENAME$. With the local harvest quickly failing
column2: the effects are already being felt--in $PROVINCENAME$
column3: the Irish are gathering in large crowds to receive aid sent by the British government. While they are grateful
column4: times are still incredibly difficult and it's clear many are considering leaving Ireland to take their chances in the New World.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC1010015;An aborted attempt at an uprising recently took place in the village of Ballingarry
column2: Ireland. A group of Irish nationalists
column3: frustrated by what they call the inept handling of the recent famine by the British government
column4: engaged in a long gunfight with a unit of constabulary until reinforcements arrived and drove the men off. Many of these nationalists have since been captured and tried
column5: but the event has sparked an increase in nationalism across the island.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC1010016;Not content to wait until the dust of the war has settled
column2: nationalists in Ireland have taken to the streets of $PROVINCENAME$ to call for the end of $COUNTRY_ADJ$ rule. With our forces engaged elsewhere
column3: their calls have quickly swept across all of $STATENAME$.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC1010020;The tone among the people in our Irish territories has changed. Many Irish nationalist who emigrated to the United States founded a militant organization called the Fenian Brotherhood there
column2: a group dedicated to freeing Ireland from $COUNTRY_ADJ$ control... and now they have formed a sister organization back home
column3: the Irish Republican Brotherhood. Already they are stirring up trouble
column4: and it seems certain they will continue until some manner of home rule is attained.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC1010021;We've received reports that the Irish Republican Brotherhood has been active in $PROVINCENAME$
column2: spreading propaganda and generally stirring up agitation against the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ government. The constabulary in $STATENAME$ has been actively hunting these nationalists down
column3: but considering many within the constabulary are Irish themselves the process has not been simple.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC1010022;The Irish Republican Brotherhood has stirred up local resentment in $PROVINCENAME$
column2: resulting in several riots and a renewed campaign against $COUNTRY_ADJ$ rule in Ireland.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC1010023;In an event organized by the Irish Republican Brotherhood
column2: a group of Irish nationalists seized key locations in the city of $PROVINCENAME$ on Easter Monday
column3: kicking off the most significant uprising in Ireland since the rebellion of 1798.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC1010024;Spurred on by increased public sympathy towards the Irish Republican Brotherhood following the Easter Rising
column2: the Sinn Féin have won a majority of seats in Ireland during the last election. They have gathered in Dublin and declared themselves Dáil Éireann
column3: the parliament of Ireland
column4: and demanded that Ireland be granted immediate full independence. Considering their popularity
column5: refusing would all but certainly trigger a war... but many agree that this is not the way to a peaceful resolution
column6: and that $COUNTRY$ should never submit to such demands.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC1010025;With Ireland once again under our control
column2: talks have begun in earnest to deal with the Irish situation once and for all... now on our terms
column3: rather than on theirs. The suggestion is that Ireland remain an autonomous Dominion under our control
column4: with any regions that wish to opt out of the new state and remain part of $COUNTRY$ able to do so. Others suggest this is unworkable
column5: and we should either simply release them and keep them as allies or annex them entirely.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC1010030;An Anglo-Irish politician by the name of Charles Stewart Parnell has just been elected to Parliament. Some are describing him as a firebrand and nationalist agitator
column2: while others suggest he's a man of remarkable charisma and organizational talent-- able to take on the entirety of the $COUNTRY_ADJ$ political system in order to push his Irish Home Rule agenda and succeed. It's very possible that this man could single-handedly turn the tide of opinion on the subject of Home Rule.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC1010031;With Charles Stewart Parnell putting forward his Home Rule agenda
column2: $COUNTRY_ADJ$ citizens in $PROVINCENAME$ have become increasingly concerned that they might end up in an independent Irish state-- one dominated by Irish catholics in Dublin. They have begun actively campaigning to ensure this doesn't happen.;;;;;;;;;;;;x

column1: EVTDESC1010032;"Charles Stewart Parnell has been successfully advancing his Home Rule Bill through Parliament
column2: and while it is continually being held up by opposition from the Upper House
column3: there is a sense that the man is managing to convince $COUNTRY_ADJ$ law-makers who-- in the not-too-distant past-- might have said that Home Rule was unthinkable./n/nNow we must consider whether his vision will see the light of day: do we grant Ireland the status of an autonomous Dominion under our control
column4: or put this aside and face renewed violence among the Irish? Either way
column5: this man Parnell will not desist
column6: and the question will keep coming before us even if we do not pass the Bill now.";;;;;;;;;;;;"x""

column1: EVTDESC1316095;Envoys from $FROMCOUNTRY$ have approached us about leasing a port town on the Guangzhou coast in exchange for a substantial sum of money. The port is of no particular consequence and would never be missed
column2: though we might wish to think twice before giving even more foreigners a foothold on our shores. Still
column3: their proposal is respectful and their offer generous.;;;;;;;;;;;;x;

column2: and control of the port town has been transferred to us. This will facilitate our trade with China and our Asian possessions.;;;;;;;;;;;;x;

column1: EVTDESC1316097;Our offer has been turned down
column2: and the Chinese seem offended that we even asked. If we still want a Chinese port
